networktest

Class Test_ShannonsTheorem

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • networktest.Test_ShannonsTheorem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class Test_ShannonsTheorem
extends junit.framework.TestCase
    JUnit Tests for Lab2 of CST8288:

    This class uses various methods of verification to ensure that all members of the ShannonsTheorem class (required for lab 2) are fully functional.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Larabie Josh, Algonquin College Staff

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main line for standalone operation.
      protected void setUp() 
      static junit.framework.Test suite() 
      protected void tearDown() 
      void testAccessors()
      Test the accessors: Determines if getSignalToNoise, getBandwidth, and maximumDataRate are accessible.

      This test was done by filling the value of a Double object (tempDouble) with the return value of the accessed method and then running a check to see if the object returned null.

      If tempDouble returns null, then the return value from the ShannonsTheorem method was not properly accessed.
      void testBehaviors()
      Test behaviors: No Behaviors are applicable for testing.
      void testConstructors()
      Test the constructors: Determines if constructor was successfully called.

      This test was done by instantiating a new instance of ShannonsTheorem, and then running a check to see if the object had a null value.

      If the object had a null value, the constructor was never called, as the object wouldn't exist.
      void testMutators()
      Test the mutators/modifiers: Determines if the bandwidth and signalToNoise values are mutable

      This test was done by calling the setter of bandwidth and signalToNoise, assigning them a random value, and then running a check to see if the value was modified.

      If the value of bandwidth/signalToNoise did not matched the random value, then bandwidth/signalToNoise was not modified.

      • testConstructors

        public void testConstructors()
        Test the constructors: Determines if constructor was successfully called.

        This test was done by instantiating a new instance of ShannonsTheorem, and then running a check to see if the object had a null value.

        If the object had a null value, the constructor was never called, as the object wouldn't exist.

      • testAccessors

        public void testAccessors()
        Test the accessors: Determines if getSignalToNoise, getBandwidth, and maximumDataRate are accessible.

        This test was done by filling the value of a Double object (tempDouble) with the return value of the accessed method and then running a check to see if the object returned null.

        If tempDouble returns null, then the return value from the ShannonsTheorem method was not properly accessed.

      • testMutators

        public void testMutators()
        Test the mutators/modifiers: Determines if the bandwidth and signalToNoise values are mutable

        This test was done by calling the setter of bandwidth and signalToNoise, assigning them a random value, and then running a check to see if the value was modified.

        If the value of bandwidth/signalToNoise did not matched the random value, then bandwidth/signalToNoise was not modified.

        Test behaviors: No Behaviors are applicable for testing.
